Boronat Tormo, F
Estornell Moragues, F
García Ibarra, F

Serrano Durbá, A
metadata.dc:description: Polyps in the urinary tract are a rare entity in infants and children. The most frequent location when they appear is the ureter. These benign lesions with no malignant potential have a varied form of presentation and in most cases must be distinguished from malignancy. The suspected diagnosis is due to urinary obstruction; nevertheless radiological evidence played a key role in the final diagnosis. The management is as less invasive as possible, with endoscopy resection or minimally invasive surgery.
metadata.dc:title: Poliposis ureteral en la adolescencia.
[Urethral polyposis in adolescence].
metadata.dc:publisher: Cirugia pediatrica : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Cirugia Pediatrica
